revision:
1. Two numerical quantities are said to be in direct proportion if the increase of one quantity leads to the increase of the other, such that if the quantities are represented as x and y –
    x/y=k OR x=ky
    For Example,
    If a man eats 3 burgers in one day, how many burgers will he eat in 20 days? The answer is 60. We arrive to this solution where here-
    No. of burgers/no. of days = k (In this case 3)
    3/1= x/20=3
    Therefore, x= 20*3=60.
    Hence, in 20 days a man will eat 60 burgers.
  2. In tabular form, directly proportional quantities might be represented in this form. Can you guess what the values of V and Z will be?
    X203040V6070
    Y23456Z
    Yes, you were right… V is 50 and Z is 7.
    With the above the given relation x/y=k (in this case k =10). Therefore,
    \( V=k \times 5 = 50\)
    Z=\(\frac {70}k = 7\)
    As shown above, in tabular form we first find the proportionality constant (k) from the given values and with the help of this constant, we can then find the given missing values.
